title: Saddlepoint approximation method
summary: The saddlepoint approximation method, initially proposed by  Daniels (1954) is a specific example of the mathematical  saddlepoint  technique applied to statistics. It provides a highly accurate approximation formula for any PDF or probability mass function of a distribution, based on the  moment generating function. There is also a formula for the  CDF  of the distribution, proposed by Lugannani and Rice (1980).
